### Steps to reproduce

https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2021-41355 

The above security risk needs patching - the Q&A just describe updating one machine by downloading a new setup file but surely, PowerShell is installed on every server and PC

Do Microsoft intend to patch this from windows update?
If not, how do they plan to assist rolling out to every known machine

Why hasnt it had more focus and a KB/hotfix via normal channels?

comments.author: doctordns
comments.body:
There are updates to 7.0.x and 7.1.x. And the daily build is updated as is, I think, the latest 7.2 preview.  I've had those for a couple of days. Whenever there's an updated version, I get the notification the next time I start PowerShell.

There is community awareness. I've seen tweets [pointing here.](https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-asks-admins-to-patch-powershell-to-fix-wdac-bypass/) And [I've posted a blog entry](https://tfl09.blogspot.com/2021/10/patching-and-powershell-7.html) and a[ post over on Spiceworks](https://community.spiceworks.com/topic/2336088-patchtime-for-powershell-7?page=1#entry-9303193). 

Also, this is not a vulnerability in WIndows Powershell, so it's only relevant where you have installed PowerShell 7.x.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: In addition to what @doctordns says, as per https://github.com/PowerShell/Announcements/issues/26, this only affects non-Windows Operating systems.
